title: How to learn to play one song on a guitar in just one week - Quora

response.answer_text: My advice is determination, patience and time management. When I want to do that with song I’d love to learn. Usually, I make the song into different parts, and day by day I learn each part alone. Of course, it’s different from a song to another. But for example, Metallica’s Nothing Else Matters. I started to learn the intro which took about 2 days or something. Then verse chords, and the chorus they didn’t take more than one day. And next I started to work on guitar licks and the solo. But for sure there are songs who take more than a week. Good luck! :D

Not quite what you’re looking for, but this would help you play something that is many songs: E - The 1 Chord in E - Learn Rock Worship GuitarA - The 4 Chord in E - Learn Rock Worship GuitarB - The 5 Chord in E - Learn Rock Worship GuitarC#m - The 6m Chord in E - Learn Rock Worship GuitarIf you work through those short videos, you’ll end up playing four very popular chord patterns along to backing tracks. So you get to see how chords fit together, and how songs are built up one chord at a time. If you play the chords in different orders, you get lots of songs. The third one can be used for Louie, louie and Wild Thing out of the oldies. But the 1–4–5 pattern is everywhere. The final one also is four chords that just power thousands of songs. As I say, not quite what you asked for, but you do get videos, backing tracks - and will pick up a bit about how songs are made. So I hope it helps.
